name: 1,3-Diphenylpropane-1,3-dione
Reason: 1,3-Diphenylpropane-1,3-dione has a melting point that can be analyzed by considering its structural components. The basic unit for comparison is benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5 degrees Celsius. The introduction of two phenyl groups increases the molecular weight and van der Waals interactions, raising the melting point by approximately +20 degrees Celsius per group. The dione functional group introduces a carbonyl group, which can participate in hydrogen bonding and rigidify the structure, contributing approximately +20 degrees Celsius. The presence of two phenyl groups and the dione functional group can contribute to an increase in the melting point.
